job_title: Research Scientist, Demography and Survey Sciences
job_text: ['', 'Deliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-end', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audience', 'Knowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)', 'Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)', 'Collaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurement', 'Master’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questions', 'Deploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questions', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audienceMaster’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questionsKnowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)', 'Develop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t do', 'Experience with Unix, Python, and large datasets (> 1TB)', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-endCollaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurementDeploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questionsDevelop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t doProvide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needsDeliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Provide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needs']

job_title: Research Scientist, Demography and Survey Sciences
job_text: ['', 'Deliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-end', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audience', 'Knowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)', 'Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)', 'Collaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurement', 'Master’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questions', 'Deploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questions', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Experience communicating analyses and results to any audienceMaster’s or Ph.D. in the social sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Communication), or in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Informatics, Econometrics) with experience answering social questionsKnowledge in data manipulation and analysis software and programming languages (R/Stata, SQL/Hive)Knowledge in quantitative and survey research methodologies (e.g., bias correction for surveys, survey sampling and design, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysis)', 'Develop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t do', 'Experience with Unix, Python, and large datasets (> 1TB)', 'Help shape the research agenda and drive research projects from end-to-endCollaborate with product teams to define relevant questions about survey methodology and quantitative measurementDeploy appropriate quantitative methodologies to answer those questionsDevelop novel approaches where traditional methods won’t doProvide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needsDeliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Provide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needs']

job_title: User Experience Researcher, Facebook Reality Labs
job_text: ['', 'Develop UX metrics to ensure quality and benchmarking of future AR/VR products', '1+ years of conducting product UX research experience', 'collaborate with other researchers on research methods and priorities', 'Experience planning UX research across the product lifecycle, from early generative to mid-cycle development, to in-market UX', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Experience in experimental design and familiarity with statistical software packages (SPSS, R, etc.)', 'Work closely with product teams to identify research questions and prioritize projects in short and long term', 'Experience building meaningful cross-functional relationships', 'proactively involve team in the research process', 'Share best practices & new techniques with the broader UX Research team', 'PhD in Cognitive/Experimental Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Anthropology, Cognitive Human Factors, or a related fieldExperience combining qualitative and quantitative user data into cohesive insightsExperience planning UX research across the product lifecycle, from early generative to mid-cycle development, to in-market UXExperience designing/researching intelligent assistive technologiesExperience in experimental design and familiarity with statistical software packages (SPSS, R, etc.)', 'Extensive experience with generative, iterative, and evaluative research methods', 'Experience with both qualitative and quantitative (e.g., survey design and analysis) research methods', 'Synthesize insights in a compelling, creative, and actionable way that cuts to the chase of the underlying user issues', 'Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative and some quantitative methods to create actionable insights across the product development lifecycle, including UX testing of early prototypes, such as usability, 1:1 and group interviews, and surveys', 'Effectively communicate with and present findings to a variety of audiences from product teams to executive leadership', 'Experience designing/researching intelligent assistive technologies', 'PhD in Cognitive/Experimental Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Anthropology, Cognitive Human Factors, or a related field', 'Development of deep expertise in the intelligent assistant space, through consumption of relevant external and internal literature, market and competitive trends, and new, primary researchWork closely with product teams to identify research questions and prioritize projects in short and long termConduct research using a wide variety of qualitative and some quantitative methods to create actionable insights across the product development lifecycle, including UX testing of early prototypes, such as usability, 1:1 and group interviews, and surveysWork closely with partner teams (product design, engineering, product management, analytics) to understand their goalsproactively involve team in the research processSynthesize insights in a compelling, creative, and actionable way that cuts to the chase of the underlying user issuesEffectively communicate with and present findings to a variety of audiences from product teams to executive leadershipDevelop UX metrics to ensure quality and benchmarking of future AR/VR productsShare best practices & new techniques with the broader UX Research teamcollaborate with other researchers on research methods and priorities', 'Development of deep expertise in the intelligent assistant space, through consumption of relevant external and internal literature, market and competitive trends, and new, primary research', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Effective communication skills with experience presenting to diverse audiences', 'Master’s Degree (MA/MS in Cognitive/Experimental Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Anthropology, Cognitive Human Factors, or MBA) or 3+ years research experience in a related field1+ years of conducting product UX research experienceExtensive experience with generative, iterative, and evaluative research methodsExperience with both qualitative and quantitative (e.g., survey design and analysis) research methodsExperience building meaningful cross-functional relationshipsEffective communication skills with experience presenting to diverse audiences', 'Experience combining qualitative and quantitative user data into cohesive insights', 'Master’s Degree (MA/MS in Cognitive/Experimental Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Anthropology, Cognitive Human Factors, or MBA) or 3+ years research experience in a related field', 'Work closely with partner teams (product design, engineering, product management, analytics) to understand their goals']

and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.', 'Lead and collaborate on research projects within a globally based team.', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Must obtain work authorization in job_title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist, Auditory Spatial Perception (PhD)
job_text: ['', 'Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.', 'Building applications in MATLAB, Audioweaver, Unity, or MaxMSP to drive real-time audio prototypes.', 'Prepare presentations for the group and deliver full analyses of new research results.', 'Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD and/or postdoctoral assignment in the field of Hearing Science, Neuroscience, Signal Processing or similar or a related field.3+ years of programming skill set in MATLAB, Python, C, or C++.3+ years of experience in statistics and/or machine learning.3+ years of experience in binaural rendering, spatial hearing, or signal processing.Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'Contribute to a strong research agenda focused on the perceptual weighting of acoustic features for sound source location.Collaborate closely with a team of researchers and engineers to design, run, and analyze experiments to determine what constitutes a perceptually relevant alteration in binaural cues.Building applications in MATLAB, Audioweaver, Unity, or MaxMSP to drive real-time audio prototypes.Prepare presentations for the group and deliver full analyses of new research results.', 'Experience in real-time audio and audio algorithms development.Experience in human auditory spatial perception.Experience in one or more of the following: Audio, Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality.Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at relevant journals or conferences, e.g. IEEE International Conference on Acoustics Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP), NeurIPS, ICML, IEEE MLSP, Acoustical Society of America (ASA), and Audio Engineering Society (AES).', 'Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.', 'Collaborate closely with a team of researchers and engineers to design, run, and analyze experiments to determine what constitutes a perceptually relevant alteration in binaural cues.', '3+ years of programming skill set in MATLAB, Python, C, or C++.', 'Experience in human auditory spatial perception.', 'Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD and/or postdoctoral assignment in the field of Hearing Science, Neuroscience, Signal Processing or similar or a related field.', 'Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at relevant journals or conferences, e.g. IEEE International Conference on Acoustics Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP), NeurIPS, ICML, IEEE MLSP, Acoustical Society of America (ASA), and Audio Engineering Society (AES).', 'Contribute to a strong research agenda focused on the perceptual weighting of acoustic features for sound source location.', '3+ years of experience in statistics and/or machine learning.', 'Preferred Qualifications', '3+ years of experience in binaural rendering, spatial hearing, or signal processing.', 'Experience in real-time audio and audio algorithms development.', 'Experience in one or more of the following: Audio, Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality.']
